item.title: Going Far Together: Open-Source Technology In Post-COVID New Zealand
item.description: “If you want to go fast, go alone; But if you want to go far, go together.” This statement about a culture I was then entering into for the first time left with me a strong impression about who New Zealanders are.

item.title: I Trust That You Will Read This
item.description: I searched for many years for this “Philisophical Statement that will take about ten minutes to read”, which includes much more songs and insight into the heart of Mr. Rogers.

item.title: sharing values+feelings and spending time+$ together
item.description: Friday, ii hosted the first #chilliforchange and spent some time asking our community to finish a few sentences: I want x, I value y, I feel z…

item.title: ii wants #chilli4change @basestationnz
item.description: We hope this initial #chili4change provides a forum for a heated discussion of innovation around an (optionally) spicy meal brought to you by ii

item.title: Pushing vagrant speed with squid for all http + https traffic
item.description: docker run proxy exports an https certificate AND three ports for http / https proxying

item.title: 5 Dollar USB Gadgets for Everyone
item.description: In my work trying to create devices that can install OSes from scratch on computers and flash phones and embedded IoT devices, I’m always looking for things that can support being both a usb host and a usb gadget.

item.title: RPi Zero Gadget Support
item.description: For most OTG supported ports, it depends on what you plug into it that decides if the port is in host mode or gadget mode. We just need to get confirmation that the RPi zero port is wired the same way for the port that has it’s usb data pins connected (not the one dedicated to power).

item.title: Digital Ocean APIv2 in chef-provisioning
item.description: Digital ocean is sunsetting api v1 on November 9th. It’s taken a while, but @geemus released support in fog v1.35.0
